meanings.definition: The state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.
meanings.sent1: The weathers in the desert can be extremely hot and dry.
meanings.sent2: The weathers in the mountains can change quickly from sunny to stormy.
meanings.sent3: The weathers during our camping trip made us appreciate the shade.
meanings.sent4: The weathers of uncertainty surrounded the outcome of the game.
meanings.sent5: The weathers of autumn painted the trees in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To come safely through a difficult period or experience.
meanings.sent1: She weathers the storm of challenges with determination.
meanings.sent2: He weathers the tough times with a positive attitude.
meanings.sent3: The team weathers the setback and bounces back stronger.
meanings.sent4: Like a sturdy ship, she weathers the waves of adversity.
meanings.sent5: He weathers through the difficulties with resilience and grace.

meanings.definition: To wear away or change the appearance or texture of (something) by long exposure to the atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The old statue weathers over time, gaining a weathered look.
meanings.sent2: The wooden fence weathers with age, turning a silvery gray.
meanings.sent3: The metal gate weathers gracefully, showing its history.
meanings.sent4: The stone steps weathers slowly, showing the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The paint weathers on the house, giving it a rustic charm.
